metadata.title: CVE-2015-0817 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The asm.js implementation in Mozilla Firefox before 36.0.3, Firefox ESR31.x before 31.5.2, and SeaMonkey before 2.33.1 does not properly determinethe cases in which bounds checking may be safely skipped during JITcompilation and heap access, which allows remote attackers to read or writeto unintended memory locations, and consequently execute arbitrary code,via crafted JavaScript.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0817` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 36.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 36.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 36.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 36.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '36.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
